battle.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a fight between opposing armies, groups of ships, groups of people etc, especially one that is part of a larger war
battle.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: a pitched battle (=a long and serious battle) between police and drug gangs
Her son was killed in battle.
battles between government forces and the rebels
battle.translation[0].definitions[1].def: a situation in which opposing groups or people compete or argue with each other when trying to achieve success or control
battle.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: a battle for custody of their children
a fierce ratings battle between rival TV stations
an ongoing battle with my mother about eating properly
battle.translation[0].definitions[2].def: an attempt to solve a difficult problem or change an unpleasant situation
battle.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: a battle against the racism of the school system
a long battle with lung cancer
Scientology has fought long battles for acceptance as a religion.
battle.translation[0].note_box[0].headin: – Meaning 3: an attempt to solve a difficult problem or change an unpleasant situation
battle.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: The police are fighting a tough battle against crime.
Many areas around here are waging a constant battle against vandalism.
It’s essential to win the battle against inflation.
a brave little girl who lost her battle against cancer
Paul faces a frantic battle to be fit for the match in November.
For most people losing weight is an uphill battle.
He faces a tough battle to prove his innocence.
As a student, life was a constant battle against debt.
She was fighting a losing battle to stop herself from crying.
battle.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to try very hard to achieve something that is difficult or dangerous
battle.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: a pressure group battling for better schools
Doctors battled to save his life.
battle.translation[1].definitions[1].def: to take part in a fight or war
